intro: Begonia hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's begonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that often display a deep green color with prominent veins. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
